‪ I watched Isle of Dogs at TOHO Cinemas Chanter in Hibiya Tokyo .‬. ‪ Many Western critics were concerned about the c ultural appropriation of this film but as a Japanese viewer I did not find the movie offensive at all The movie is filled with details only a Japanese person or someone who has really emerged themselves in our culture can appreciate .‬. Sure there were the typical depictions of Japan :‬ sushi sumo wrestlers cherry blossom s Hokusai and even mushroom clouds .‬. ‪ But I saw so much more than that. ‪ First of all the title 犬ヶ島 Isle of dogs is reminiscent of 鬼ヶ島 ," a fiction al place in a famous Japanese fable 桃太郎 ”.. And here are few others :. 屏風絵 painting on folding screens )‬. 牛乳瓶 the nostalgic glass milk cartons. 一本 締め a common practice to clap your hands to celebrate the c onclusion of something. So for that thank you Mr Anderson Thank you for not just using Japan as an aesthetic but thoroughly engaging in the Japanese culture and portraying it so authentically through you r style.
